title: Understand the Energy Exchange
text: When a piece of zinc is dropped into water, the zinc will absorb heat and the water will release heat until they reach the same temperature. This is the concept of heat transfer where the energy lost by the water is equal to the energy gained by the zinc.

title: Set Up the Heat Exchange Equation
text:
Use the equation:
$$m_w$$ * $$c_w$$ * (T_i,w - T_f) $$=$$ $$m_z$$ * $$c_z$$ * (T_f - T_i,z)

Where:

$$m_w$$: mass of water
$$c_w$$: specific heat capacity of water
$$T_{i,w}$$: initial temperature of water
$$T_f$$: final temperature of both
$$m_z$$: mass of zinc
$$c_z$$: specific heat capacity of zinc
$$T_{i,z}$$: initial temperature of zinc

title: Identify the Known and Unknown Variables
Solve for Final Temperature $$T_f$$
text: Equate the heat gained by zinc to the heat lost by water and solve for $$T_f$$:\n$$200$$ × $$4.22(373$$ - T_f) $$=$$ $$60$$ × 0.389(T_f - 293)
